newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-RUSSELL MAY FACE DISCIPLINARY ACTION OVER BOOK.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RUSSELL MAY FACE DISCIPLINARY ACTION OVER BOOK.

text.p: England wicketkeeper Jack Russell faces the prospect of disciplinary action from the country's cricket authorities over a chapter in his forthcoming autobiography.
The book to be published next month is believed to include a controversial section on England captain Mike Atherton and former chairman of selectors Ray Illingworth.
Under the terms of their contract, players should have items for publication approved by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB).

The ECB want Gloucestershire's Russell to have another look at the chapter, and its administration secretary Tony Brown said: "He knows perfectly well what the rules are with regard to a book by a player."
Russell's agent, Jim Ruston, said: "The whole thing is very tame compared with some of the books you can buy today and the ECB is very sensitive. They are a law unto themselves."
